when_to_say: Used to refer to a book or text.
example: यह पुस्तक बहुत ज्ञानवर्धक है। (Yeh pustak bahut gyanvardhak hai) - This book is very informative.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a home or residence.
example: मेरा गृह बहुत सुंदर है। (Mera grih bahut sundar hai) - My house is very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to talk about drinking water or any form of water.
example: पानी जीवन के लिए आवश्यक है। (Pani jeevan ke liye aavashyak hai) - Water is essential for life.

when_to_say: Used to express joy or delight.
example: खुशी हर किसी की चाहत है। (Khushi har kisi ki chahat hai) - Happiness is everyone’s desire.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a place of learning.
example: मैं रोज स्कूल जाता हूँ। (Main roj school jata hoon) - I go to school every day.

when_to_say: Used to talk about a companion or pal.
example: मेरा सबसे अच्छा दोस्त राज है। (Mera sabse accha dost Raj hai) - My best friend is Raj.

when_to_say: Used to refer to any automobile.
example: यह गाड़ी बहुत तेज़ है। (Yeh gadi bahut tez hai) - This car is very fast.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the star in the sky.
example: सूरज सुबह उगता है। (Suraj subah ugta hai) - The sun rises in the morning.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the moon in the night sky.
example: चाँद रात में चमकता है। (Chand raat mein chamakta hai) - The moon shines at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to stars in the sky.
example: रात में सितारे बहुत चमकते हैं। (Raat mein sitare bahut chamakte hain) - Stars shine brightly at night.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the sky above.
example: आसमान नीला दिखता है। (Aasman neela dikhta hai) - The sky looks blue.

when_to_say: Used to refer to affection or deep care.
example: प्यार सबसे खूबसूरत भावना है। (Pyaar sabse khoobsurat bhavna hai) - Love is the most beautiful emotion.

when_to_say: Used to talk about strength or energy.
example: शक्ति से हर मुश्किल हल हो सकती है। (Shakti se har mushkil hal ho sakti hai) - With power, every problem can be solved.

when_to_say: Used to talk about understanding or wisdom.
example: ज्ञान सबसे बड़ी संपत्ति है। (Gyan sabse badi sampatti hai) - Knowledge is the greatest asset.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend or companion.
example: एक अच्छा मित्र हमेशा मदद करता है। (Ek accha mitra hamesha madad karta hai) - A good friend always helps.

when_to_say: Used to talk about one’s mother.
example: माता का प्रेम अनमोल है। (Mata ka prem anmol hai) - A mother’s love is priceless.

when_to_say: Used to talk about one’s father.
example: पिता परिवार के आधार हैं। (Pita parivar ke adhaar hain) - Father is the foundation of the family.

when_to_say: Used to talk about one’s brother.
example: भाई हमेशा मददगार होता है। (Bhai hamesha madadgar hota hai) - A brother is always helpful.

when_to_say: Used to talk about one’s sister.
example: मेरी बहन बहुत प्यारी है। (Meri behan bahut pyari hai) - My sister is very loving.

when_to_say: Used to refer to calmness or tranquility.
example: शांति मन की आवश्यकता है। (Shanti man ki aavashyakta hai) - Peace is a necessity for the mind.

when_to_say: Used to talk about meals or food.
example: स्वस्थ भोजन जरूरी है। (Swasth bhojan zaroori hai) - Healthy food is essential.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water in general.
example: जल जीवन है। (Jal jeevan hai) - Water is life.

when_to_say: Used to talk about learning or education.
example: शिक्षा सबसे महत्वपूर्ण है। (Shiksha sabse mahatvapurn hai) - Education is the most important.

when_to_say: Used to refer to physical or mental health.
example: स्वास्थ्य धन है। (Swasthya dhan hai) - Health is wealth.

when_to_say: Used to refer to music or melody.
example: संगीत आत्मा की भाषा है। (Sangeet atma ki bhasha hai) - Music is the language of the soul.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the environment or natural world.
example: प्रकृति की रक्षा करना जरूरी है। (Prakriti ki raksha karna zaroori hai) - Protecting nature is essential.

when_to_say: Used to refer to weather conditions.
example: आज का मौसम सुहाना है। (Aaj ka mausam suhana hai) - Today's weather is pleasant.

when_to_say: Used to talk about mountains.
example: पर्वत पर बर्फ गिरी है। (Parvat par barf giri hai) - Snow has fallen on the mountain.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sea or ocean.
example: समुद्र विशाल और गहरा है। (Samudra vishal aur gahra hai) - The sea is vast and deep.

when_to_say: Used to refer to trees or plants.
example: वृक्ष हमें छाया देते हैं। (Vriksh humein chhaya dete hain) - Trees provide us shade.

when_to_say: Used to talk about flowers.
example: फूल बहुत सुंदर होते हैं। (Phool bahut sundar hote hain) - Flowers are very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to talk about birds in nature.
example: पक्षी आसमान में उड़ते हैं। (Pakshi aasman mein udte hain) - Birds fly in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to talk about forests or wilderness.
example: जंगल में कई जानवर रहते हैं। (Jangal mein kai janwar rehte hain) - Many animals live in the forest.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the lion, the king of the jungle.
example: सिंह जंगल का राजा है। (Singh jangal ka raja hai) - The lion is the king of the jungle.

when_to_say: Used to talk about horses.
example: घोड़ा तेज़ दौड़ सकता है। (Ghoda tez daud sakta hai) - A horse can run fast.

when_to_say: Used to refer to dogs.
example: कुत्ता वफादार होता है। (Kutta wafadar hota hai) - A dog is loyal.

when_to_say: Used to refer to cats.
example: बिल्ली दूध पी रही है। (Billi doodh pee rahi hai) - The cat is drinking milk.

when_to_say: Used to refer to fishes.
example: मछली पानी में रहती है। (Machhli pani mein rehti hai) - Fish live in water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to elephants.
example: हाथी बड़ा और शक्तिशाली होता है। (Haathi bada aur shaktishaali hota hai) - An elephant is big and powerful.

when_to_say: Used to talk about turtles.
example: कछुआ धीरे चलता है। (Kachhua dheere chalta hai) - A turtle moves slowly.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the sun.
example: सूरज पूरब से निकलता है। (Sooraj poorab se nikalta hai) - The sun rises in the east.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the moon.
example: चांद रात में चमकता है। (Chaand raat mein chamakta hai) - The moon shines at night.

when_to_say: Used to talk about stars in the sky.
example: आसमान में कई सितारे हैं। (Aasman mein kai sitaare hain) - There are many stars in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to daytime or a calendar day.
example: दिन उजाला लेकर आता है। (Din ujala lekar aata hai) - The day brings light.

when_to_say: Used to talk about nighttime.
example: रात को चांद निकलता है। (Raat ko chaand nikalta hai) - The moon appears at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to early morning hours.
example: सुबह का समय शांति देता है। (Subah ka samay shaanti deta hai) - Morning time gives peace.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the evening.
example: शाम को सूरज डूबता है। (Shaam ko sooraj doobta hai) - The sun sets in the evening.

when_to_say: Used to talk about a duration of seven days.
example: एक सप्ताह में सात दिन होते हैं। (Ek saptaah mein saat din hote hain) - There are seven days in a week.

when_to_say: Used to talk about a calendar month.
example: साल में बारह महीने होते हैं। (Saal mein barah maheene hote hain) - There are twelve months in a year.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a full year.
example: एक वर्ष में 365 दिन होते हैं। (Ek varsh mein 365 din hote hain) - There are 365 days in a year.

when_to_say: Used to refer to timepieces.
example: घड़ी समय दिखाती है। (Ghadi samay dikhati hai) - A clock shows the time.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the passage of time.
example: समय अमूल्य है। (Samay amoolya hai) - Time is precious.

when_to_say: Used to talk about historical events.
example: इतिहास से हमें सीख मिलती है। (Itihaas se humein seekh milti hai) - We learn from history.

when_to_say: Used to talk about upcoming times.
example: भविष्य अनिश्चित है। (Bhavishya anishchit hai) - The future is uncertain.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the current time.
example: वर्तमान का महत्व समझो। (Vartaman ka mahatva samjho) - Understand the importance of the present.

when_to_say: Used to refer to natural or artificial light.
example: प्रकाश अंधकार को मिटाता है। (Prakash andhkaar ko mitaata hai) - Light removes darkness.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the absence of light.
example: अंधकार में कुछ भी दिखता नहीं। (Andhkaar mein kuch bhi dikhta nahi) - Nothing is visible in darkness.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky above.
example: आकाश नीला है। (Aakash neela hai) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the planet Earth.
example: पृथ्वी हमारा घर है। (Prithvi hamara ghar hai) - Earth is our home.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: जल जीवन का आधार है। (Jal jeevan ka aadhar hai) - Water is the basis of life.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a place of living.
example: मेरा घर बड़ा है। (Mera ghar bada hai) - My house is big.

when_to_say: Used to talk about an educational institution.
example: मैं स्कूल जाता हूँ। (Main school jata hoon) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a garden or park.
example: बाग़ में फूल हैं। (Baag mein phool hain) - There are flowers in the garden.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a chair.
example: कुर्सी आरामदायक है। (Kursi aaraamdayak hai) - The chair is comfortable.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a table.
example: मेज़ पर किताबें हैं। (Mez par kitaabein hain) - There are books on the table.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a door.
example: द्वार खुला है। (Dwaar khula hai) - The door is open.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a window.
example: खिड़की से हवा आ रही है। (Khidki se hawa aa rahi hai) - The wind is coming through the window.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a sofa.
example: सोफा बहुत आरामदायक है। (Sofa bahut aaraamdayak hai) - The sofa is very comfortable.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the kitchen.
example: रसोई में खाना बन रहा है। (Rasoi mein khana ban raha hai) - Food is being prepared in the kitchen.

when_to_say: Used to talk about kitchen utensils.
example: बर्तन साफ़ करना है। (Bartan saaf karna hai) - The utensils need to be cleaned.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a spoon.
example: चमच से खाना खाओ। (Chamach se khana khao) - Eat with a spoon.

when_to_say: Used to refer to garbage or trash.
example: कचरा बाहर फेंक दो। (Kachra baahar phenk do) - Throw the garbage outside.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the floor of a room.
example: फर्श पर धूल है। (Farsh par dhool hai) - There is dust on the floor.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the wall.
example: दीवार पर चित्र लगे हैं। (Deewaar par chitra lage hain) - There are pictures on the wall.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the roof of a building.
example: छत से बारिश आ रही है। (Chat se baarish aa rahi hai) - Rain is coming from the roof.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a safe or vault.
example: तिजोरी में पैसे रखे हैं। (Tijori mein paise rakhe hain) - Money is kept in the safe.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a blanket.
example: कंबल बहुत गर्म है। (Kambal bahut garm hai) - The blanket is very warm.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a towel.
example: तौलिया गीला है। (Tauliya geela hai) - The towel is wet.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a throne.
example: राजा सिंहासन पर बैठा है। (Raja singhasan par baitha hai) - The king is sitting on the throne.

when_to_say: Used to refer to slippers.
example: खड़ाऊं मेरे पैरों में हैं। (Khadaun mere pairon mein hain) - The slippers are on my feet.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sun.
example: सूरज तेज़ चमक रहा है। (Sooraj tez chamak raha hai) - The sun is shining brightly.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the moon.
example: चाँद रात में दिखता है। (Chaand raat mein dikhta hai) - The moon appears at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a star.
example: आसमान में बहुत सारे तारे हैं। (Aasman mein bahut saare taare hain) - There are many stars in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a tree.
example: वृक्षों पर पत्ते हैं। (Vrikshon par patte hain) - There are leaves on the trees.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a flower.
example: यह फूल बहुत खूबसूरत है। (Yeh phool bahut khoobsurat hai) - This flower is very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bird.
example: पक्षी आसमान में उड़ रहे हैं। (Pakshi aasman mein ud rahe hain) - Birds are flying in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a mosquito.
example: मच्छर मुझे काट रहे हैं। (Machchar mujhe kaat rahe hain) - Mosquitoes are biting me.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a snake.
example: साँप जंगल में रहता है। (Saap jangl mein rehta hai) - The snake lives in the jungle.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a horse.
example: घोड़ा तेज़ दौड़ता है। (Ghoda tez daudta hai) - The horse runs fast.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cow.
example: गाय हमें दूध देती है। (Gaay humein doodh deti hai) - The cow gives us milk.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a goat.
example: बकरी दूध देती है। (Bakri doodh deti hai) - The goat gives milk.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an elephant.
example: हाथी बहुत बड़ा जानवर है। (Haathi bahut bada janwar hai) - The elephant is a very large animal.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a dog.
example: कुत्ता बहुत वफादार होता है। (Kutta bahut wafadar hota hai) - The dog is very loyal.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cat.
example: बिल्ली घर में रहती है। (Billi ghar mein rehti hai) - The cat lives in the house.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a fish.
example: मछली पानी में तैरती है। (Machhli paani mein tairti hai) - The fish swims in the water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an hour.
example: हम एक घंटा इंतजार करेंगे। (Hum ek ghanta intezaar karenge) - We will wait for one hour.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the daytime.
example: आज का दिन बहुत अच्छा है। (Aaj ka din bahut accha hai) - Today's day is very nice.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the night.
example: रात को मैं सोता हूँ। (Raat ko main sota hoon) - I sleep at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky.
example: आकाश में बादल हैं। (Aakash mein baadal hain) - There are clouds in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the weather.
example: मौसम आज ठंडा है। (Mausam aaj thanda hai) - The weather is cold today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a house.
example: हमारे घर में एक बगीचा है। (Hamare ghar mein ek bageecha hai) - There is a garden in our house.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a room.
example: मेरा कमरा बहुत सुंदर है। (Mera kamra bahut sundar hai) - My room is very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bed.
example: बिस्तर पर एक तकिया है। (Bistar par ek takiya hai) - There is a pillow on the bed.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a dream.
example: मैंने एक अच्छा सपना देखा। (Maine ek accha sapna dekha) - I saw a good dream.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a door.
example: दरवाजा बंद है। (Darwaza band hai) - The door is closed.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a window.
example: खिड़की से सूरज की रोशनी आ रही है। (Khidki se sooraj ki roshni aa rahi hai) - The sunlight is coming through the window.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a wall.
example: दीवार पर एक चित्र है। (Deewaar par ek chitra hai) - There is a picture on the wall.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a roof.
example: छत पर बहुत गर्मी है। (Chat par bahut garmi hai) - It is very hot on the roof.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a courtyard.
example: आँगन में एक बड़ा पेड़ है। (Aangan mein ek bada ped hai) - There is a big tree in the courtyard.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a ladder.
example: सीढ़ी से ऊपर चढ़ो। (Seedhi se upar chhodo) - Climb the ladder.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the floor.
example: फर्श बहुत साफ है। (Farsh bahut saaf hai) - The floor is very clean.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a kitchen.
example: रसोई में खाना पक रहा है। (Rasoi mein khana pak raha hai) - Food is cooking in the kitchen.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a museum.
example: हम संग्रहालय जा रहे हैं। (Ham sangrahalay ja rahe hain) - We are going to the museum.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: पानी पीना स्वास्थ्य के लिए अच्छा है। (Pani peena swasthya ke liye accha hai) - Drinking water is good for health.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cupboard.
example: आलमारी में किताबें हैं। (Aalmaari mein kitabein hain) - There are books in the cupboard.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a table.
example: मेरे पास एक मेज़ है। (Mere paas ek mez hai) - I have a table.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a chair.
example: कुर्सी आरामदायक है। (Kursi aaramdayak hai) - The chair is comfortable.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a fan.
example: पंखा तेज़ चल रहा है। (Pankha tez chal raha hai) - The fan is running fast.

when_to_say: Used to refer to light.
example: कमरे में लाइट बंद है। (Kamre mein light band hai) - The light in the room is off.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an animal.
example: पशु हमारे पर्यावरण का हिस्सा हैं। (Pashu hamare paryavaran ka hissa hain) - Animals are a part of our environment.

when_to_say: Used to refer to help or assistance.
example: मुझे तुम्हारे सपोर्ट की ज़रूरत है। (Mujhe tumhare support ki zarurat hai) - I need your support.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is positive.
example: तुम्हारा दृष्टिकोण बहुत सकारात्मक है। (Tumhara drishtikon bahut sakaratmak hai) - Your attitude is very positive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is negative.
example: उसका दृष्टिकोण नकारात्मक था। (Uska drishtikon nakaratmak tha) - His attitude was negative.

when_to_say: Used to refer to hope.
example: मेरे मन में एक आशा है। (Mere man mein ek asha hai) - I have a hope in my mind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to trust.
example: मुझे तुम पर विश्वास है। (Mujhe tum par vishwas hai) - I trust you.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an agreement or compromise.
example: हमें समझौता करना होगा। (Humein samjhota karna hoga) - We will have to make a compromise.

when_to_say: Used to refer to help or assistance.
example: वह मेरी सहायता कर रहा है। (Wah meri sahayata kar raha hai) - He is helping me.

when_to_say: Used to refer to power or strength.
example: उसमें बहुत शक्ति है। (Usmein bahut shakti hai) - He has a lot of strength.

when_to_say: Used to refer to patience.
example: सहनशीलता सफलता की कुंजी है। (Sahansheelta safalta ki kunji hai) - Patience is the key to success.

when_to_say: Used to refer to hard work.
example: परिश्रम से ही सफलता मिलती है। (Parishram se hi safalta milti hai) - Success comes from hard work.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is intelligent or stylish.
example: वह बहुत स्मार्ट है। (Wah bahut smart hai) - He is very smart.

when_to_say: Used to refer to patience or endurance.
example: धैर्य रखो, सब ठीक हो जाएगा। (Dhairya rakho, sab theek ho jayega) - Be patient, everything will be fine.

when_to_say: Used to refer to time.
example: समय का सदुपयोग करो। (Samay ka sadupyog karo) - Make good use of time.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a target or goal.
example: लक्ष्य प्राप्त करना जरूरी है। (Lakshya prapt karna zaroori hai) - It is important to achieve the goal.

when_to_say: Used to refer to progress or development.
example: हमारा देश तेजी से विकास कर रहा है। (Hamara desh tezi se vikas kar raha hai) - Our country is developing rapidly.

when_to_say: Used when trying to understand something.
example: तुम क्या समझ रहे हो? (Tum kya samajh rahe ho?) - What are you understanding?

when_to_say: Used to refer to worry or anxiety.
example: चिंता करने से कुछ नहीं होगा। (Chinta karne se kuch nahi hoga) - Worrying won't help.

when_to_say: Used to refer to success.
example: सफलता मेहनत पर निर्भर करती है। (Safalta mehnat par nirbhar karti hai) - Success depends on hard work.

when_to_say: Used to refer to intense effort or hard work.
example: कड़ी मेहनत से ही सफलता मिलती है। (Kadi mehnat se hi safalta milti hai) - Only through hard work comes success.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something ordinary or common.
example: यह एक सामान्य बात है। (Yeh ek samanya baat hai) - This is a common thing.

when_to_say: Used to refer to science or scientific knowledge.
example: विज्ञान ने बहुत तरक्की की है। (Vigyaan ne bahut tarakki ki hai) - Science has made a lot of progress.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something that is natural.
example: प्राकृतिक संसाधन सीमित हैं। (Prakritik sansadhan seemit hain) - Natural resources are limited.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the planet Earth.
example: पृथ्वी पर जीवन है। (Prithvi par jeevan hai) - There is life on Earth.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky.
example: आसमान में बादल हैं। (Aasmaan mein baadal hain) - There are clouds in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to climate or weather conditions.
example: हमारा जलवायु गर्म है। (Hamare jalvaayu garm hai) - Our climate is hot.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the ocean.
example: समुद्र में लहरें हैं। (Samudra mein lahre hain) - There are waves in the ocean.

when_to_say: Used to refer to snow.
example: बर्फ बहुत ठंडी होती है। (Barf bahut thandi hoti hai) - Snow is very cold.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a forest.
example: जंगल में बहुत सारे पेड़ हैं। (Jangal mein bahut saare ped hain) - There are many trees in the forest.

when_to_say: Used to refer to birds.
example: पक्षी आसमान में उड़ रहे हैं। (Pakshi aasmaan mein ud rahe hain) - Birds are flying in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an animal.
example: यह जानवर जंगल में रहता है। (Yeh jaanwar jangal mein rehta hai) - This animal lives in the jungle.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: मैं पानी पी रहा हूँ। (Main paani pee raha hoon) - I am drinking water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to fire.
example: अग्नि बहुत गर्म होती है। (Agni bahut garm hoti hai) - Fire is very hot.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sun.
example: सूरज उग चुका है। (Suraj ug chuka hai) - The sun has risen.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the moon.
example: चाँद रात में चमकता है। (Chaand raat mein chamakta hai) - The moon shines at night.

when_to_say: Used to refer to clouds.
example: आसमान में बादल हैं। (Aasmaan mein baadal hain) - There are clouds in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to sunlight.
example: धूप बहुत तेज है। (Dhoop bahut tez hai) - The sunlight is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to refer to wind.
example: हवा तेज चल रही है। (Hawa tez chal rahi hai) - The wind is blowing fast.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something rising, like the sun.
example: सूरज उगने वाला है। (Suraj ugne wala hai) - The sun is about to rise.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something sinking.
example: नाव डूबने वाली है। (Naav doobne wali hai) - The boat is about to sink.

when_to_say: Used to refer to shaking something.
example: हवा पेड़ को हिला रही है। (Hawa ped ko hila rahi hai) - The wind is shaking the tree.

when_to_say: Used to refer to knowledge or wisdom.
example: ज्ञान सबसे बड़ी संपत्ति है। (Gyaan sabse badi sampatti hai) - Knowledge is the greatest wealth.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the truth or honesty.
example: सच्चाई हमेशा जीतती है। (Sacchai hamesha jeetati hai) - Truth always wins.

when_to_say: Used to refer to patience or endurance.
example: धैर्य से काम लें। (Dhairya se kaam len) - Work with patience.

when_to_say: Used to refer to courage or bravery.
example: साहस से सभी डर पर काबू पाया जा सकता है। (Saahas se sabhi dar par kaabu paaya ja sakta hai) - Courage can overcome all fears.

when_to_say: Used to refer to struggle or conflict.
example: संघर्ष के बाद ही सफलता मिलती है। (Sangharsh ke baad hi safalta milti hai) - Success comes after struggle.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a solution or resolution.
example: समाधान खोजना मुश्किल हो सकता है। (Samaadhaan khojna mushkil ho sakta hai) - Finding a solution can be difficult.

when_to_say: Used to refer to development or growth.
example: देश का विकास आवश्यक है। (Desh ka vikaas aavashyak hai) - The development of the country is essential.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a dream or aspiration.
example: आपका सपना क्या है? (Aapka sapna kya hai?) - What is your dream?

when_to_say: Used to refer to understanding or comprehension.
example: समझ से काम करें। (Samajh se kaam karein) - Work with understanding.

when_to_say: Used to refer to equality or fairness.
example: समानता सभी के लिए जरूरी है। (Samaanta sabhi ke liye zaroori hai) - Equality is important for everyone.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a system or arrangement.
example: व्यवस्था में सुधार आवश्यक है। (Vyavastha mein sudhaar aavashyak hai) - Improvement in the system is necessary.

when_to_say: Used to refer to time.
example: समय का प्रबंधन करें। (Samay ka prabandhan karein) - Manage your time.

when_to_say: Used to refer to experience.
example: अनुभव सबसे अच्छा शिक्षक है। (Anubhav sabse accha shikshak hai) - Experience is the best teacher.

when_to_say: Used to refer to inspiration or motivation.
example: प्रेरणा से लक्ष्य प्राप्त करें। (Prerna se lakshya praapt karein) - Achieve your goal through inspiration.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something that is the same.
example: हम दोनों के पास समान किताबें हैं। (Ham dono ke paas samaan kitaabein hain) - We both have the same books.

when_to_say: Used to refer to independence or freedom.
example: भारत एक स्वतंत्र देश है। (Bharat ek svatantra desh hai) - India is an independent country.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something natural.
example: यह प्राकृतिक दृश्य बहुत सुंदर है। (Yeh prakritik drishya bahut sundar hai) - This natural scenery is very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something real or authentic.
example: यह एक वास्तविक समस्या है। (Yeh ek vastavik samasya hai) - This is a real problem.

when_to_say: Used to refer to imagination or fantasy.
example: कल्पना की कोई सीमा नहीं होती। (Kalpana ki koi seema nahi hoti) - Imagination has no limits.

when_to_say: Used to refer to success or achievement.
example: सफलता मेहनत से मिलती है। (Safalta mehnat se milti hai) - Success comes with hard work.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a message or communication.
example: उसने मुझे एक संदेश भेजा। (Usne mujhe ek sandesh bheja) - He sent me a message.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a right or entitlement.
example: हर नागरिक को अपने अधिकारों का पालन करना चाहिए। (Har nagrik ko apne adhikaron ka paalan karna chahiye) - Every citizen should follow their rights.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a dispute or argument.
example: विवाद में शामिल न हो। (Vivaad mein shamil na ho) - Do not get involved in the debate.

when_to_say: Used to refer to being self-reliant or independent.
example: हमें आत्मनिर्भर बनना चाहिए। (Humein aatmanirbhar banna chahiye) - We should become self-reliant.

when_to_say: Used to refer to society or community.
example: समाज में बदलाव लाने की आवश्यकता है। (Samaaj mein badlaav laane ki aavashyakta hai) - There is a need for change in society.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a deadline or time limit.
example: समय सीमा को पूरा करें। (Samay seema ko poora karein) - Complete the task within the deadline.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a relationship or connection.
example: हमारे बीच अच्छा संबंध है। (Hamare beech accha sambandh hai) - We have a good relationship.

when_to_say: Used to refer to freedom or independence.
example: स्वतंत्रता हमारे अधिकारों का प्रतीक है। (Svatantrata hamare adhikaron ka prateek hai) - Freedom is a symbol of our rights.

when_to_say: Used to refer to responsibility or duty.
example: हर नागरिक का दायित्व है कि वह कानून का पालन करे। (Har nagrik ka daayitva hai ki wah kanoon ka paalan kare) - Every citizen has the responsibility to follow the law.

when_to_say: Used to refer to equal rights.
example: समानाधिकार सभी नागरिकों का हक है। (Samaanaadhikaar sabhi nagrikon ka hak hai) - Equal rights are the right of all citizens.

when_to_say: Used to refer to wealth or money.
example: धन से सुख नहीं खरीदी जा सकती। (Dhan se sukh nahi khareedi ja sakti) - Wealth cannot buy happiness.

when_to_say: Used to refer to justice or fairness.
example: न्याय का पालन सभी को करना चाहिए। (Nyaay ka paalan sabhi ko karna chahiye) - Everyone should follow justice.

when_to_say: Used to refer to necessity or need.
example: यह एक अत्यंत आवश्यक वस्तु है। (Yeh ek atyant aavashyak vastu hai) - This is an extremely necessary item.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something that is developed or advanced.
example: हमारा देश अब विकसित हो चुका है। (Hamare desh ab vikasit ho chuka hai) - Our country is now developed.

when_to_say: Used to refer to being alert or cautious.
example: हमें हमेशा सतर्क रहना चाहिए। (Humein hamesha satark rehna chahiye) - We should always remain alert.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a solution or resolution.
example: इस समस्या का समाधान ढूंढना होगा। (Is samasya ka samaadhaan dhoondhna hoga) - We need to find the solution to this problem.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a situation or condition.
example: यह एक कठिन परिस्थिति है। (Yeh ek kathin paristhiti hai) - This is a difficult situation.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a celebration or festival.
example: हमने दीपावली का उत्सव मनाया। (Hamne Deepawali ka utsav manaya) - We celebrated Diwali festival.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something positive or optimistic.
example: सकारात्मक सोच से जीवन बेहतर होता है। (Sakaaraatmak soch se jeevan behtar hota hai) - Positive thinking makes life better.

when_to_say: Used to refer to success or achievement.
example: सफलता मेहनत से मिलती है। (Safalta mehnat se milti hai) - Success comes with hard work.
